item.title: Miscellanous
item.description: Convergence in probability Definition a sequence $\{X_n\}$ of random variable converges in probability towards the random variable $X$ if for all $\epsilon > 0$ $$ \lim_{n \leftarrow \infty} \mathbb{P}(|X_n - X| > \epsilon) = 0 $$ Consistent estimator A statistic (singular) is any quantity computed from values in a sample which is considered fro a statistical purpose (estimating population parameter, describing sample, evaluating hypothesis). Sufficient statistics A statistic is sufficient with respect to a statisticcal model and its associated unknown parameter if no other statistic can be
